features.name: Flurry of Blows
features.desc:
At 1st level, a monk can make a flurry of blows as a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. When making a flurry of blows, the monk can make one additional attack at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. This additional attack stacks with the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} attacks from haste and other similar effects. When using this ability, the monk can make these attacks with any combination of his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes and weapons that have the monk special weapon quality. He takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for using multiple weapons when making a flurry of blows, but he does not gain any additional attacks beyond what's already granted by the flurry for doing so. (He can still gain additional attacks from a high base attack bonus, from this ability, and from haste and similar effects).
At 11th level, a monk can make an additional attack at his highest base attack bonus whenever he makes a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.

features.name: Improved Unarmed Strike
features.desc: You are considered to be armed even when {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} — you can make unarmed {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} (if Medium; 1d2 if Small).

features.name: AC Bonus
features.desc:
When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a monk gains a +1 bonus to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
These bonuses to AC apply even against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or when the monk is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. He loses these bonuses when he is immobilized or {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}, when he wears any armor, when he carries a shield, or when he carries a medium or heavy load.

features.name: Stunning Fist
features.desc:
You know just where to strike to temporarily stun a foe.
You must use this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before you make your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} (thus, a failed attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} ruins the attempt). Stunning Fist forces a foe {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attack{/g} to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally. A defender who fails this saving throw is stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (until just before your next turn). A stunned character drops everything held, can't take {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to AC. You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained, and no more than once per round. Constructs, oozes, plants, undead, {g|Encyclopedia:Incorporeal_Touch_Attack}incorporeal{/g} creatures, and creatures immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} cannot be stunned.

features.name: Unarmed Strike
features.desc:
At 1st level, a monk gains Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by a Medium monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike increases with level: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} at levels 1–3, 1d8 at levels 4–7, 1d10 at levels 8–11, 2d6 at levels 12–15, 2d8 at levels 16–19, and 2d10 at level 20.
If the monk is Small, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d4 at levels 1–3, 1d6 at levels 4–7, 1d8 at levels 8–11, 1d10 at levels 12–15, 2d6 at levels 16–19, and 2d8 at level 20.
If the monk is Large, his unarmed strike damage increases as follows: 1d8 at levels 1–3, 2d6 at levels 4–7, 2d8 at levels 8–11, 3d6 at levels 12–15, 3d8 at levels 16–19, and 4d8 at level 20.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Monk Proficiencies
features.desc:
Monks are proficient with the club, crossbow (light or heavy), dagger, handaxe, javelin, kama, nunchaku, quarterstaff, sai, shortsword, shortspear, shuriken, siangham, sling, spear, and any weapon with the monk special weapon quality.
Monks are not proficient with any armor or shields.
When wearing armor, using a shield, or carrying a medium or heavy load, a monk loses his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}, as well as his fast movement and flurry of blows abilities.

features.name: Evasion
features.desc: A character can avoid even magical and unusual {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with great agility. If a character makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against an attack that normally deals half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, he instead takes no damage. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of evasion.

features.name: Ki Pool
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a monk gains a pool of ki points, supernatural energy he can use to accomplish amazing {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. The number of points in a monk's ki pool is equal to 1/2 his monk level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. As long as he has at least 1 point in his ki pool, he can make a ki strike.
At 3rd level, ki strike allows his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
At 7th level, his unarmed {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are also treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
At 10th level, his unarmed attacks are also treated as lawful weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
At 16th level, his unarmed attacks are treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction and bypassing hardness.
By spending 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a monk can make one additional unarmed strike at his highest attack {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} when making a flurry of blows attack. This bonus attack stacks with all bonus attacks gained from flurry of blows, as well as those from haste and similar effects. A monk gains additional powers that consume points from his ki pool as he gains levels.
The ki pool is replenished each morning after 8 hours of {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g} or meditation; these hours do not need to be consecutive.

features.name: Fast Movement
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a monk gains a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. A monk in armor or carrying a medium or heavy load loses this extra speed.
For every 3 levels above 3rd, the bonus improves by 10 feet.

features.name: Ki Strike — Magic
features.desc: At 3rd level, ki strike allows the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.

features.name: Still Mind
features.desc: At 4th level, a monk gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against Enchantment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.

features.name: Ki Power
features.desc: At 4th level and every 2 levels thereafter, a monk can select one ki power. These powers allow the monk to perform amazing feats of mystical power and acrobatic prowess by expending points from his ki pool. Once a ki power is selected, it cannot be changed. Some ki powers require the monk to be of a specific level or higher before they can be chosen. Unless otherwise noted, a monk cannot select an individual ki power more than once.

features.name: Stunning Fist: Fatigue
features.desc: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target fatigued for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.

features.name: Purity of Body
features.desc: At 5th level, a monk gains immunity to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases.

features.name: Style Strike
features.desc: At 5th level, a monk can learn one type of style strike. Whenever he makes a flurry of blows, he can designate one of his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes as a style strike. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} is resolved as normal, but it has an additional effect depending on the type of strike chosen. At 9th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk learns an additional style strike. He must choose which style strike to apply before the attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} is made. At 15th level, he can designate up to two of his unarmed strikes each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a style strike, and each one can be a different type.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Ki Strike — Cold Iron and Silver
features.desc: At 7th level, the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} are treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.

features.name: Stunning Fist: Sicken
features.desc: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target sickened for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.

features.name: Improved Evasion
features.desc: This ability works like evasion, except that while the character still takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, he henceforth takes only half damage on a failed save. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.

features.name: Ki Strike — Lawful
features.desc: At 10th level, the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} are treated as lawful weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Ki Strike — Adamantine
features.desc: At 16th level, the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} are treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and bypassing hardness.

features.name: Ki Power: Perfect Self
features.desc: At 20th level, a monk becomes a magical creature. The monk gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/chaotic, which allows him to ignore the first 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} made by a nonchaotic weapon or by any {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g} made by a creature that doesn't have similar damage reduction.

features.name: Scaled Fist Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a scaled fist can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Dragon Style, Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm, Dazzling Display, Dragon Ferocity.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Dragon Roar.
A scaled fist need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Scaled Fist Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a scaled fist can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Dragon Style, Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm, Dazzling Display, Dragon Ferocity.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Dragon Roar.
A scaled fist need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Scaled Fist Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a scaled fist can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Dragon Style, Intimidating Prowess.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm, Dazzling Display, Dragon Ferocity.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Dragon Roar.
A scaled fist need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Stunning Fist: Fatigue
features.desc: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target fatigued for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.

features.name: Stunning Fist: Sicken
features.desc: This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target sickened for 1 minute on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} instead of stunning for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.

features.name: Mystic Powers
features.desc:
At 6th level, a sensei may use his advice ability when spending points from his ki pool to activate a class ability (using the normal {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} required for each) in order to have that ability affect one ally within 30 feet rather than the sensei himself.
At 10th level, a sensei may affect all allies within 30 feet rather than himself (spending points from his ki pool only once, not once for each target).

features.name: Mystic Powers
features.desc:
At 6th level, a sensei may use his advice ability when spending points from his ki pool to activate a class ability (using the normal {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} required for each) in order to have that ability affect one ally within 30 feet rather than the sensei himself.
At 10th level, a sensei may affect all allies within 30 feet rather than himself (spending points from his ki pool only once, not once for each target).

features.name: Mystic Wisdom
features.desc:
At 10th level, a sensei may spend 1 point from his ki pool (as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}) while using advice to provide a single ally within 30 feet with evasion, fast movement, high jump, purity of body, or slow fall.
At 14th level, a sensei may spend 2 points to grant one of the abilities listed above to all allies within 30 feet, or provide improved evasion to a single ally within 30 feet. These abilities function at the sensei's level and last 1 minute.

features.name: Mystic Wisdom
features.desc:
At 10th level, a sensei may spend 1 point from his ki pool (as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}) while using advice to provide a single ally within 30 feet with evasion, fast movement, high jump, purity of body, or slow fall.
At 14th level, a sensei may spend 2 points to grant one of the abilities listed above to all allies within 30 feet, or provide improved evasion to a single ally within 30 feet. These abilities function at the sensei's level and last 1 minute.

features.name: Insightful Strike
features.desc: At 2nd level, a sensei may use his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} in lieu of his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes or monk weapons.

features.name: Quarterstaff Damage
features.desc: At 4th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was one {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category larger.

features.name: Quarterstaff Damage
features.desc: At 12th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was two {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger.

features.name: Quarterstaff Damage
features.desc: At 20th level, in hands of a quarterstaff master all quarterstaves deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as if it was three {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger.

features.name: Style Strike — Disarm
features.desc: At 13th level, quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free disarm attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.

features.name: Style Strike — Sunder
features.desc: At 9th level, quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free sunder attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.

features.name: Style Strike — Trip
features.desc: At 5th level, quarterstaff master can use his quarterstaff to make his first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a flurry of blows make a free trip attempt, which does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.

features.name: Zen Archer Bonus Feat
features.desc:
A zen archer's bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} must be taken from the following list:
Combat Reflexes, Deflect Arrows, Dodge, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, and Rapid Shot.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved Precise Shot, Manyshot and {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} and Clustered Shot.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Zen Archer Bonus Feat
features.desc:
A zen archer's bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} must be taken from the following list:
Combat Reflexes, Deflect Arrows, Dodge, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, and Rapid Shot.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved Precise Shot, Manyshot and {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} and Clustered Shot.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Zen Archer Bonus Feat
features.desc:
A zen archer's bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} must be taken from the following list:
Combat Reflexes, Deflect Arrows, Dodge, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, and Rapid Shot.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved Precise Shot, Manyshot and {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g}.
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list:
Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g} and Clustered Shot.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: AC Bonus
features.desc: When unarmored, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a monk gains a +1 bonus to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.

features.name: Fast Movement
features.desc: At 3rd level, a monk gains a +10 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, which increases by 10 feet every 3 levels thereafter. A monk in armor loses this extra speed.

features.name: AC Bonus (Charisma)
features.desc: When unarmored, the scaled fist adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a scaled fist gains a +1 bonus to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four scaled fist levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.

features.name: AC Bonus
features.desc:
When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. In addition, a monk gains a +1 bonus to AC and CMD at 4th level. This bonus increases by 1 for every four monk levels thereafter, up to a maximum of +5 at 20th level.
These bonuses to AC apply even against {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or when the monk is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. He loses these bonuses when he is immobilized or {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}, when he wears any armor, when he carries a shield, or when he carries a medium or heavy load.

features.name: Draconic Heritage
features.desc:
At 3rd level, the scaled fist has gained some control over the draconic energies she studies. She must select one type of dragon.
Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. The scaled fist can expend 1 point from her ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to imbue her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} with the energy specific to this dragon, causing them to deal an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her monk level.
At 12th level, a scaled fist can spend 3 points from her ki pool to make a breath weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This breath weapon deals 1d6 points of damage of her energy type per monk level in a 30-foot cone or 60-foot line. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 the scaled fist's monk level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to halve the normal damage.

features.name: Draconic Mettle
features.desc: At 3rd level, a scaled fist gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} attempted against all fear, paralysis, and sleep effects.

features.name: Ki Pool
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a monk gains a pool of ki points, supernatural energy he can use to accomplish amazing {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. The number of points in a monk's ki pool is equal to 1/2 his monk level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. As long as he has at least 1 point in his ki pool, he can make a ki strike.
At 3rd level, ki strike allows his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
At 7th level, his unarmed {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are also treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
At 10th level, his unarmed attacks are also treated as lawful weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.
At 16th level, his unarmed attacks are treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction and bypassing hardness.
By spending 1 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a monk can make one additional unarmed strike at his highest attack {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} when making a flurry of blows attack. This bonus attack stacks with all bonus attacks gained from flurry of blows, as well as those from haste and similar effects. A monk gains additional powers that consume points from his ki pool as he gains levels.
The ki pool is replenished each morning after 8 hours of {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}rest{/g} or meditation; these hours do not need to be consecutive.

features.name: Ki Power
features.desc: At 4th level and every 2 levels thereafter, a monk can select one ki power. These powers allow the monk to perform amazing feats of mystical power and acrobatic prowess by expending points from his ki pool. Once a ki power is selected, it cannot be changed. Some ki powers require the monk to be of a specific level or higher before they can be chosen. Unless otherwise noted, a monk cannot select an individual ki power more than once.

features.name: Advice
features.desc:
A sensei's advice is identical to bardic performance, allowing him to inspire courage at 1st level, inspire competence at 3rd level, and inspire greatness at 9th level, as a bard of the sensei's level, usable a total number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to his level + his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
Starting a bardic performance is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, but it can be maintained each round as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. Changing a bardic performance from one effect to another requires the sensei to stop the previous performance and start a new one as a standard {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}. A bardic performance cannot be disrupted, but it ends immediately if the sensei is killed, paralyzed, stunned, knocked {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, or otherwise prevented from taking a free action to maintain it each round. A sensei cannot have more than one bardic performance in effect at one time.

features.name: Inspire Courage
features.desc: A 1st level sensei can use his performance to inspire courage in his allies (including himself), bolstering them against fear and improving their combat abilities. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive the sensei's performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and fear effects and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. At 5th level, and every six sensei levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level.

features.name: Inspire Competence
features.desc: A sensei of 3rd level or higher can use his performance to help allies succeed at a task. They must be within 30 feet and able to see and hear the sensei. They get a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} as long as they continue to hear the sensei's performance. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the sensei has attained beyond 3rd (+3 at 7th, +4 at 11th, +5 at 15th, and +6 at 19th).

features.name: Inspire Greatness
features.desc: A sensei of 9th level or higher can use his performance to inspire greatness in all allies within 30 feet, granting extra fighting capability. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} (d10s), the commensurate number of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} (apply the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.

features.name: Ki Power: Wholeness of Body
features.desc: By spending 2 point from his ki pool as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the monk can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to his monk level.

features.name: Ki Power: Abundant Step
features.desc: At 8th level or higher, a monk can slip magically between spaces, as if using the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} dimension door. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} that consumes 2 points from his ki pool. He cannot take other creatures with him when he uses this ability.

features.name: Ki Power: Diamond Body
features.desc: A monk gains immunity to poisons of all kinds.

features.name: Ki Power: Diamond Soul
features.desc: A monk gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to his current monk level + 10. In order to affect the monk with a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, a spellcaster must get a result on a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level) that equals or exceeds the monk's spell resistance.

features.name: Ki Power: Quivering Palm
features.desc: A monk can set up vibrations within the body of another creature that can thereafter be fatal if the monk so desires. You make touch attack and if it succeeds the target must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + 1/2 the monk's level + the monk's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} modifier) or die. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that costs 4 ki points.

features.name: Perfect Strike
features.desc:
You must declare that you are using this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before you make your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} (thus a failed attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} ruins the attempt). You can roll your attack roll twice and take the higher result. You may attempt a perfect attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special).
Special: A zen archer or quarterstaff master monk receives Perfect Strike as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. A monk may attempt an perfect strike attack a number of times per day equal to his monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels he has in classes other than monk.

features.name: Zen Archer Weapon Proficiency
features.desc: Zen archers are proficient with longbows, shortbows, composite longbows, and composite shortbows in addition to their normal {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}weapon proficiencies{/g}.

features.name: Flurry of Blows
features.desc:
Starting at 1st level, a zen archer can make a flurry of blows as a full-{g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, but only when using a bow (even though it is a ranged weapon). He may not make a flurry of blows with his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} or any other weapons. A zen archer does not apply his {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with flurry of blows unless he is using a composite bow with a Strength rating.
A zen archer's flurry of blows otherwise functions as normal for a monk of his level.
A zen archer cannot use Rapid Shot or Manyshot when making a flurry of blows with his bow.

features.name: Way of the Bow
features.desc:
At 2nd level, a zen archer gains Weapon Focus as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} with one type of bow.
At 6th level, the monk gains Weapon Specialization with the same weapon as a bonus feat, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.

features.name: Point Blank Master
features.desc: At 3rd level, a zen archer gains Point Blank Master as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if he does not meet the prerequisites.

features.name: Zen Archery
features.desc: At 3rd level, a zen archer may use his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier instead of his {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} when using a bow.

features.name: Ki Arrows
features.desc: At 5th level, a zen archer always deal his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with the arrows from his bows. For example, a Medium zen archer's short bow normally deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} damage; using this ability, his arrows deal 1d8 damage.

features.name: Snap Shot
features.desc: While wielding a ranged weapon, you {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threaten{/g} squares within your melee {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g}. You can make {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} with that ranged weapon. You do not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity when making a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} as an attack of opportunity.

features.name: Skills
features.desc: A sohei gains {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}.

features.name: Flurry of Blows
features.desc:
At 1st level, a monk can make a flurry of blows as a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. When making a flurry of blows, the monk can make one additional attack at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. This additional attack stacks with the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} attacks from haste and other similar effects. When using this ability, the monk can make these attacks with any combination of his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes and weapons that have the monk special weapon quality. He takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for using multiple weapons when making a flurry of blows, but he does not gain any additional attacks beyond what's already granted by the flurry for doing so. (He can still gain additional attacks from a high base attack bonus, from this ability, and from haste and similar effects).
At 11th level, a monk can make an additional attack at his highest base attack bonus whenever he makes a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.

features.name: Weapon and Armor Proficiency
features.desc: A sohei is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g} and with light armor, instead of a monk's usual weapon and armor proficiencies.

features.name: Unarmed Strike
features.desc: A sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} does not increase at 4th level and above.

features.name: Monastic Mount
features.desc: At 1st level a sohei gains a horse as a mount. A sohei may spend 1 point from his ki pool to grant his mount temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to twice his level for 1 hour per level.

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Devoted Guardian
features.desc: A sohei gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} equal to 1/2 his monk level. At 20th level, a sohei's initiative roll is automatically a natural 20.

features.name: Bonus Feats
features.desc: A sohei may select Mounted Combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as bonus feats.

features.name: Ki Strike — Magic
features.desc: At 3rd level, ki strike allows sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.

features.name: Ki Weapon
features.desc: At 4th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a sohei may spend 1 point from his ki pool to grant any weapon he wields (including his {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike) a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, increasing by +1 per four levels after 4th to a maximum bonus of +5 at 20th level, until the end of his next turn.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Weapon Training
features.desc: At 6th level, a sohei gains weapon training in one of the following weapon groups, as the fighter class feature: bows, crossbows, monk weapons, polearms, spears, or thrown weapons. He may select an additional group of weapons for every six levels after 6th, to a maximum of three at 18th level. A sohei may use flurry of blows and ki strike with any weapon in which he has weapon training.

features.name: Ki Strike — Cold Iron and Silver
features.desc: At 7th level, ki strike allows sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as cold iron and silver for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Ki Strike — Lawful
features.desc: At 10th level, ki strike allows sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as lawful weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.

features.name: Weapon Training
features.desc: At 6th level, a sohei gains weapon training in one of the following weapon groups, as the fighter class feature: bows, crossbows, monk weapons, polearms, spears, or thrown weapons. He may select an additional group of weapons for every six levels after 6th, to a maximum of three at 18th level. A sohei may use flurry of blows and ki strike with any weapon in which he has weapon training.

features.name: Ki Strike — Adamantine
features.desc: At 16th level, ki strike allows sohei's {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} and any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons for which he has weapon training to be treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} and bypassing hardness.

features.name: Hard as Stone
features.desc: At 2nd level, whenever an opponent {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} to confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against a student of stone, treat the student of stone's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} as +4 higher than normal.

features.name: Strength of Stone
features.desc: At 3rd level, a student of stone learns to draw {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g} from the earth. So long as he is touching the ground, the student of stone gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, bull rush and trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, and to his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when resisting a bull rush or trip attempt.

features.name: Student of Stone Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 6th level, a student of stone adds Elemental Fist to his list of available bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. If the student of stone selects Elemental Fist as a bonus feat, he may only deal {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} when using the feat.
At 10th level, the student of stone adds Shaitan Style to his list of bonus feats.
At 14th level, he adds Shaitan Skin.
At 18th level, he adds Shaitan Earthblast.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Bones of Stone
features.desc:
At 7th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a student of stone can spend 1 ki point to gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 2/magic until the beginning of his next turn.
At 10th level, he can spend 1 ki point to gain DR 2/chaotic until his next turn.
At 15th level, he can spend 1 ki point to gain DR 5/chaotic until his next turn.

features.name: Body of Stone
features.desc: At 9th level, a student of stone gains the benefits of the light fortification armor property.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Soul of Stone
features.desc:
At 12th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a student of stone can spend 1 ki point to gain tremorsense 15 feet until his next turn.
At 16th level, the range of this tremorsense increases to 30 feet.
Tremorsense: You can perceive the world by creating high-pitched noises and listening to their echoes. This gives you blindsight of equal range.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Monk Bonus Feat
features.desc:
At 1st level, 2nd level, and every 4 levels thereafter, a monk can select a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. These feats must be taken from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Crane Style, Blind Fight, Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}Initiative{/g}, Deflect Arrows.
At 6th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved Trip, Improved Disarm
At 10th level, the following feats are added to the list: Improved {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}Critical{/g}, Improved Blind Fight.
A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.

features.name: Stone Self
features.desc: At 20th level, a student of stone becomes an outsider with the earth subtype. He gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/chaotic, and tremorsense 20 feet.

features.name: Flurry of Blows
features.desc:
At 1st level, a quarterstaff master can make a flurry of blows as a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. When making a flurry of blows, the monk can make one additional attack at his highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. This additional attack stacks with the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} attacks from haste and other similar effects. When using this ability, the quarterstaff master can make these attacks only with quarterstaves.
At 11th level, a quarterstaff master can make an additional attack at his highest base attack bonus whenever he makes a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.

name: Monk
desc: Monks excel at overcoming even the most daunting perils, striking where it's least expected, and taking advantage of enemy vulnerabilities. Fleet of foot and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skilled{/g} in combat, monks can navigate any battlefield with ease, aiding allies wherever they are needed most.

archetypes.name: Scaled Fist
archetypes.desc: Steeped in traditions that trace their origins to the warrior-monks who trained under the tutelage of draconic masters, scaled fists eschew passive introspection in favor of unshakable confidence. Scaled fists learn to combine brutal intimidation with the brazen ferocity of an ancient wyrm to devastate their foes.

archetypes.name: Sensei
archetypes.desc: The sensei is a revered teacher who imparts lessons on the oneness of mind, body, and spirit, along with occasional correction that is subtle and swift. Rather than using {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}wisdom{/g} for his own benefit alone, he uses it to better those around him.

archetypes.name: Traditional Monk
archetypes.desc: Traditional monks walk the strict path of discipline which thousands of predecessors trod before them. They sacrifice the freedom to choose their power in exchange for steeled willpower and the trusted set of traditional abilities.

archetypes.name: Zen Archer
archetypes.desc: Some monks seek to become one with another weapon entirely — the bow. The zen archer takes a weapon most other monks eschew and seeks perfection in the pull of a taut bowstring, the flex of a bow's limbs, and the flight of an arrow fired true.

archetypes.name: Sohei
archetypes.desc: The sohei are masters of the horse and the hunt. A monastic soldier, the sohei is equally adept at combat afoot or on horseback. While {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skilled{/g} in {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} techniques, many sohei favor weapons they can use while mounted on horseback or against others' horses.

archetypes.name: Student of Stone
archetypes.desc: By following the path of the stone, students of stone give up much of monk's {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}mobility{/g} in favor of sheer resilience.

archetypes.name: Quarterstaff Master
archetypes.desc: Some monks focus their efforts on perfecting the way of one of the simplest weapons — a quarterstaff. They train until the quarterstaff becomes a natural extension of their own body.
